1.text: Brethren, if a man be taken in any fault, ye the spiritual, restore such a one in the spirit of meekness; observing thyself narrowly, lest thou also be tempted.

2.text: Bear one anotherâ€™s burdens, and so fill up the law of Christ:

3.text: For if any think to be something, being nothing, he deceives himself.

4.text: And let each try his own work, and then in himself alone will he have boasting, and not in another.

5.text: For each shall bear his own load.

6.text: Let him being taught the word participate with him teaching in all good things.

7.text: Be not deceived; God is not mocked: for whatever a man should sow, that also shall he reap.

8.text: For he sowing to his flesh of the flesh shall reap corruption; but he sowing to the Spirit, of the Spirit shall reap eternal life.

9.text: And doing good let us not despond: for in proper time we shall reap, not being enervated.

10.text: Wherefore then as we have time, let us work good to all, and chiefly to them of the household of faith.

11.text: See ye how large letters I wrote to you with mine own hand.

12.text: As many as: wish to have an agreeable demeanor in the flesh, they compel you to be circumcised; only lest they should be driven out for the cross of Christ.

13.text: For neither they being circumcised themselves observe the law; but they wish you to be circumcised, that they might boast in your flesh.

14.text: And it may not be to me to boast, except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom the world is crucified to me, and I to the world.

15.text: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision has any power, nor uncircumcision but a new creation.

16.text: And as many as walk by this model, place upon them, and mercy, and upon the Israel of God.

17.text: For the rest let none cause me fatigues: for I bear the marks of the Lord Jesus Christ in my body.

18.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ with your spirit, brethren. Amen.
